title: The sexual abuse I experienced as a young girl was overlooked. After 20 years, I found a story that speaks to me.
text: A decade after my childhood abuse stopped, I experienced rape at the hands of a stranger. When I told others what had happened, they quickly recognized it for the violation it was. Not a single person questioned me — in fact, they empathized with me. My pain, my PTSD, was validated because of the circumstances of the assault — it was dark, it was an alleyway — and the identity of the attacker: an older male stranger. Their easy belief in that particular story, though, is not necessarily a good thing, because the flipside of it means that other stories, stories that break away from what we have been told violation looks like, are less easily believed. I experienced this firsthand, all those times I tried to talk about the abuse in my childhood.
description: My abuser was a female peer, close to my own age, and both of us were still children
authors: Katie Simon Is Currently Working On A Memoir About The Year She Got The Plague.
